body: Can you explain in which cases this feature is helpful? For example, Why are there multiple `'12h'`s in the graph and what the x axis means?
Try to set [dimension](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#visualMap-continuous.dimension) to be 0.
这不是 bug 吧，通过调整 barGap 会移动柱子位置是符合预期的，文字在中间也是预期的。然后因为柱子位置移动了，所以不居中了，所以看起来文字文职不对齐了。我没理解错吧？如果是这样的话，应该就不是 bug。
@almaAdipso Please debug by yourself and provide a minimum demo for us.
`formatter` shouldn't be async.
Please refer to the console and see if there are any errors?
This should have been fixed in previous releases. Please use 4.5.0 to test. You may re-open this issue if you find it doesn't work.
@pissang Please help review this.
Can you provide a demo? https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html
@Ovilia no, #8490 is unrelated. It's just that is problem is blocking me from testing if #8490 is fixed (which I believe it is)
Can you provide a demo at https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html ?

I checked current master and test with `dist` or build then test with the `dist`, neither of which can reproduce this.
But it's strange that https://www.echartsjs.com/examples/zh/editor.html?c=graph-webkit-dep&renderer=svg alse is echarts-4.5.0.

> Can you explain in which cases this feature is helpful? For example, Why are there multiple `'12h'`s in the graph and what the x axis means?

The x axis is a category axis, which means time frame in this case.
The currency name is on the bubble. For different currencies, there are time frames for them to compare upon.

Why is it needed to adjust the interval distance?

Because if same group of currencies are nearer. And different currencies are separated as shown in the graph. It will be much easier to visualize them.

Or if this function is not supported, everything item on the category axis have same distance. I cannot tell the currencies when I glance at the intersection areas of the currencies.

Sorry, I haven't realized how broken the example in the initial comment was. Turns out that creating an issue using https://ecomfe.github.io/echarts-issue-helper removes all  `+` in the code, replaced by ` `. Fixed now

> Yours is much better. Good job.

Thanks~ but I thought your fix is much simpler and should work as well.
Added images since the bug seem to depend on what timezone you are in which may not be obvious.

The color of the line is not dependent neither on values of y-axis nor on values of x-axis . So I can't use dimension to set the color. It's dependent on other values which we're not plotting on the graph. In the above comment I mentioned it.
@SmallBlackZhang 布局过程的旋转动画没找到可行的解决方法。
So the distance is for grouping? `12h`, `1h`, `30m` should be each a series, and `usd`, `eur` should be x values.
Put that value in the data like `[[x1, y1, extraValue1], [x2, y2, extraValue2]]` and set `dimension` to be `2`.

> So the distance is for grouping? `12h`, `1h`, `30m` should be each a series, and `usd`, `eur` should be x values.

Yes. If there is a callback function for me to adjust the distance between category labels, the problem can be solved.

The `usd`, `eur` are not technically x values, they are name of the series. Each series contains 3 value with x values `12h`, `1h`, `30m`.
Seems to be a bug.
Reproduced with UK timezone.
你好，我也遇到了map tooltip拿不到数据的情况，请问要怎么解决
@huangbo225 Please refer to the console and see if there are any errors?
@Ovilia 在示例的控制台中没有错误，运行正常。
@Ovilia 您好，您知道如何引用该部分的代码吗？

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. 🎉
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! 🍵

1.  鼠标移动到地图的hover上，每次卡顿后，hover出的label也会消失不见。
2.  尝试过appendData不会卡顿，但是没有相关的方法去removeData，这样数据越来越多，导致攻击线也会越来越多。
给tooltip的div添加css属性transform: translateZ(0);可以解决

用字符串模板 有 问题 -- formatter: '{a}
{b0}: {c0}%
{b1}: {c1}%' 默认第一组数据 + 0.01？

I found an issue after merged this pull request.

```js
layout.startAngle === layout.endAngle
```

This is only available for the bar on polar. But there is no validation here and it brokes the bar on normal cartesian coordinate system.

I will make another pull request to fix this issue.

@100pah (1) is not bug. It's because `maxLength2` is set to be `minLength2` when `minLength2` is bigger than `maxLength2`. If you set `maxLength2` to be a smaller number, the previous state will come back.

这个是 阿里云控制台首页的账单统计，各个柱子是各类比如服务器类，数据库类，文件存储类等的花费，能一眼看出，1. 在每个月花费最多的是哪几类 2. 最多的几类顺序是否发生了变化 我老板特别想要这样的图，不过我现在更广泛地调研了一下，诸如g2, amchat, google chart, high chart，看起来也没有提供层叠柱状图的自定义排序功能，所以可能确实这不是一个强需求吧，你们也觉得不是强需求就close吧

你的这个截图貌似也不是按花费的顺序排列的，最下面的绿色的那条看起来比它上面那条要高。
如果要实现：

> 1. 在每个月花费最多的是哪几类 2. 最多的几类顺序是否发生了变化

这个两个效果的话，是不是这种图更能表达清楚：https://www.echartsjs.com/examples/zh/editor.html?c=bar-label-rotation

> 支持，height

但是文档里没写, 并且d.ts声明文件里也没有height属性

> 你的这个截图貌似也不是按花费的顺序排列的，最下面的绿色的那条看起来比它上面那条要高。
> 如果要实现：
> 
> > 1. 在每个月花费最多的是哪几类 2. 最多的几类顺序是否发生了变化
> 
> 这个两个效果的话，是不是这种图更能表达清楚：https://www.echartsjs.com/examples/zh/editor.html?c=bar-label-rotation

最下面的绿条是把过多的小项整合为其他，所以才会看起来数值比上边的大，思路还是按数值排序吧。分组柱状图支持的分组数量比较少吧，分组稍微多一些感觉空间就不够。

> 最下面的绿条是把过多的小项整合为其他，所以才会看起来数值比上边的大。

原来是这样，我刚才没get到最下面的绿条是把过多的小项整合为其他的意思。

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. 🎉
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! 🍵
